info.michaelkohler.helpertools.io

Class FileHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.michaelkohler.helpertools.io.FileHelper

  • public final class FileHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    The |FileHelper| is a static class which helps managing file paths.
    Version:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Lukas Diener

      • makeFile

        public static java.io.FileOutputStream makeFile(java.lang.String... path)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Creates or opens a file for output. If sub-directories in the path do not exist, they are created too.
        Parameters:
        path - array of folders representing the path of the file to create
        Returns:
        FileOutputStream for the new file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that the OutputStream could not be created

      • makeFile

        public static java.io.FileOutputStream makeFile(java.lang.String dirname,
                                java.lang.String filename,
                                boolean append)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Creates or opens a file for output. If sub-directories in the path do not exist, they are created too. If the file exists, it is overwritten, unless append is true. append determines whether to open in append mode.
        Parameters:
        dirname - path to the file
        filename - name of the file to create
        append - whether to append or overwrite the file if it exists
        Returns:
        FileOutputStream for the new file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that the OutputStream could not be created

        public static void createFolders(java.io.File path)

      • pathName

        public static java.lang.String pathName(java.lang.String path)
        Gets the path name of the given path. Example: fileName("C:\\Users\\ChuckNorris\\passwords.txt") returns "C:\Users\ChuckNorris"
        Parameters:
        path - a file path
        Returns:
        the path name

      • splitPath

        public static java.lang.String[] splitPath(java.lang.String path)
        Splits a path and a filename in its parts. Example: splitPath("C:\\Users\\John\\Image.jpg") returns ["C:", "Users", "John", "Image.jpg"]
        Parameters:
        path - input path
        Returns:
        String array consisting of path and filename

      • append

        public static java.io.File append(java.lang.String baseFile,
                  java.lang.String name)
        Returns a new file after adding the specified file/folder to the end of the path. Example: append("C:\Users\John", "Image.jpg"); returns File["C:\Users\John\Image.jpg"]
        Parameters:
        baseFile - input path
        name - name of file/folder to add
        Returns:
        the new object

      • append
